Test,0206 https://en.wikinews.org/wiki/Powerful_earthquake_rocks_Vanuatu_archipelago Creative Commons Attribution 2.5
Report: Powerful earthquake rocks Vanuatu archipelago
Test, Test (WIKINEWS) _ An earthquake with the likely magnitude of 7.0 struck the Oceanian nation of Vanuatu at 11:30 PM VUT Saturday (10:30 UTC Sunday). There were no reports of casualties. A tsunami warning for "waves reaching 0.3 to one meter [3.9 feet] above the tide level" along the coasts of Vanuatu, New Caledonia and the Solomon Islands issued by the United States Geological Survey after the quake was quickly lifted after none materialized.
(PROFILE (WS SL:Test; CT:i; (REG:ENGL;) (REG:EARTHQUAKE;) (LANG:ENGLISH;)) )

BC-Australia-flood https://en.wikinews.org/wiki/%22One-in-100-year_flood_event%22_devastates_Western_Australia Creative Commons Attribution 2.5
"One-in-100-year flood event" devastates Western Australia
Test, Test (WIKINEWS) _ Aerial evacuations took place and food was airlifted in yesterday after a devastating flood Western Australia emergency services minister Stephen Dawson called the 'worst in a century' isolated communities in the Kimberley. Flooding began last week after heavy rain from Tropical Cyclone Ellie swelled local rivers, bolstered by La Ni√±a. Notably, the Fitzroy River broke a 2002 record of 13.95 meters (45.8 ft), reaching a water level of 15.81 meters (51.9 ft) on Wednesday, according to a Bureau of Meteorology spokesperson. Authorities estimate it could take months
